image.altText: A university building.

props.synopsis: Thousands of students are getting fast-tracked qualifications to work in childcare centres and it's compromising safety standards, experts warn.

title.children: Documents expose disturbing details about next generation of childcare students

image.altText: A woman wearing a black jacket looks up at a man wearing a blue business shirt and brown jacket on a boardwalk at a beach.

props.synopsis: Australians aged in their 30s and 40s are experiencing unprecedented and in some cases world-leading rates of 10 different types of cancer — and scientists are desperate to understand why.

title.children: 'Something's happened': Australians under 50 developing cancer at 'alarming' rates

image.altText: A woman leaning against a clothing rail with knitted products.

props.synopsis: The potential of four rate cuts is welcome news for millions of borrowers and business owners, but a double-edged sword for first homebuyers with property prices tipped to pick up further as a result.

title.children: Potential 'meltdown' could see four interest rate cuts by early next year

image.altText: An aerial photo of a new housing estate with empty blocks and several new houses being built.

props.synopsis: To meet the government's housing target every year there will need to be infill land created about 26 times the size of Melbourne's CBD across Australia.

title.children: Where is Australia going to build thousands of new homes?

image.altText: A man in a blue top, jeans and a cap holds up a sign that says "hate won't bring peace" outside a white building.

props.synopsis: The attacks on Jewish people in Melbourne on Friday night should send chills down the spines of all Australians — Jewish and non-Jewish — who value diversity, culture and the right to be safe.

title.children: Melbourne's horrifying antisemitic attacks should force Australians to reject false binaries

image.altText: A photo of a woman taken from the side. She's holding a cane and sitting on a stool with her amputated legs showing.

props.synopsis: After Gill Hicks was rescued from the wreckage of a tube train following London's 7/7 terrorist attacks in 2005, she was so severely injured her hospital identification wristband read, "One unknown — estimated female".

title.children: Australian survivor of London 7/7 attacks marks 20-year anniversary with 'performance of a lifetime'

image.altText: The burned front door of a synagogue in Melbourne.

props.synopsis: Premier Jacinta Allan says a new taskforce will work to crack down on antisemitism after a synagogue in Melbourne's east was set on fire on Friday.

title.children: New Victorian police taskforce announced in wake of 'sickening' antisemitic attacks

image.altText: A group of people walking towards the camera, with the coroner in the centre of the picture

props.synopsis: Northern Territory Coroner Elisabeth Armitage will today hand down her long-awaited findings from an inquest into the 2019 police shooting death of Kumanjayi Walker in Yuendumu.

title.children: Findings into police shooting of Kumanjayi Walker to be delivered in Yuendumu

image.altText: Reserve Bank of Australia

props.synopsis: The ASX is poised for a flat opening ahead of the US lifting its 90-day pause on tariff increases. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: ASX cautious before RBA rates decision and end of tariff pause

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Trump focussing on 12 key trade deals
ASX set for a flat opening ahead of RBA decision tomorrow

image.altText: Senator Malarndirri McCarthy

props.synopsis: Indigenous Australians Minister Malarndirri McCarthy says "now is the time" to consider a federal truth-telling process. Follow live.

title.children: Indigenous Australians minister says 'now is time' to take steps on truth-telling

image.altText: A young girl crying with her head in her hands outside a camp accommodation building.

props.synopsis: Children from a Christian summer camp are among those still missing after flash flooding killed dozens of people in Texas.

title.children: Texas floods death toll rises to 78 as search continues for dozens still missing, including children

image.altText: Australian players Sam Konstas, Beau Webster, Mitchell Starc and Pat Cummins celebrate a Test victory over West Indies.

props.synopsis: Australia bowls out the West Indies for 143 to secure a 133 run second Test victory and take an unassailable 2-0 lead in the series.

title.children: Australia retains Frank Worrell Trophy with dominant victory over West Indies

image.altText: Oscar Piastri walks from his car in parc ferme with his head bowed

props.synopsis: Oscar Piastri has been denied victory in the Formula 1 British Grand Prix after being handed a 10-second penalty for a safety car infringement.

title.children: Controversial penalty costs Piastri victory as championship lead is cut

image.altText: woman with cream scarf and sandy coloured hair, looking sad

props.synopsis: Louise Van Loon went to the police seeking help to protect children. They took out an intervention order against her.

title.children: Alleged abuse victim calls for systemic change to protect children

image.altText: A map highlighting Hodeidah and Yemen

props.synopsis: The crew of a commercial vessel in the Red Sea off Yemen was forced to abandon ship after being struck by grenades and gunfire, according to a UK agency run by the British Navy.

title.children: Crew abandons ship attacked in the Red Sea, UK agency reports

image.altText: An action shot from a game of state of origin rugby league.

props.synopsis: The State of Origin series is still anyone's game as we head into a blockbuster decider. Here's what to know about the series finale.

title.children: Ready for State of Origin Game III? Here's what to know ahead of kick-off

image.altText: Men posing with a man in a hospital bed

props.synopsis: A doctor who amputated the leg of a Lithuanian rafter to free him from rapids in Tasmania's Franklin River has been awarded the Life Saving Cross in Vilnius.

title.children: Hero doctor receives Lithuanian award after Franklin River rescue

image.altText: Jordan Thompson of Australia leans on the net

props.synopsis: Australian Jordan Thompson retires from his round-of-16 match at Wimbledon against Taylor Fritz with a back injury, while Cruz Hewitt wins his first match in the Wimbledon junior singles.

title.children: Lleyton Hewitt's son wins Wimbledon debut as Thompson forced to retire

image.altText: A blurred man is being reprimanded by another man.

props.synopsis: NSW Police is appealing for information over the alleged murder of a 32-year-old man and its potential connection with two cases involving torture and attempted murder interstate.

title.children: 'Contract crew' potentially behind Sydney killing, kidnapping and torture

image.altText: A close-up of a woman with a serious expression

props.synopsis: More than 500 current and former supermarket workers across regional South Australia will receive $5.5 million in back pay, after securing what their union describes as "one of the biggest retail underpayment settlements" in the state's history.

title.children: More than 500 supermarket workers to share in $5.5m after court settlement

image.altText: Two men stand in front of a haul truck at Griffin Coal Mine in Collie, WA.

props.synopsis: A key foreign-owned WA coal mine slides almost a billion dollars further into debt, despite the state government pouring hundreds of millions of dollars into the insolvent company.

title.children: Troubled WA coal mine falls $800m further into debt

image.altText: A man covered in coal dust.

props.synopsis: Former supervisor Ryan Martin escaped a major methane blaze at a Queensland mine and helped source bottles of water to pour on severely burnt colleagues.

title.children: Underground coal miner sues Anglo after 'traumatic' explosions

image.altText: Two Tasmania Police officers stand next to a patrol car.

props.synopsis: In Tasmania, prosecutors must prove that children aged 10 to 14 who have committed crimes have an understanding of the moral wrongfulness of their actions, but the Liberals say they will look at instead requiring defence lawyers to prove their clients do not have this understanding.

title.children: Liberals look at reversing legal principle in youth offender crackdown

image.altText: A computer screen with notes written under sub-headings.

props.synopsis: AI tools are becoming more prevalent in healthcare, helping overworked doctors to carry the workload. But experts say there are real risks, including accuracy and data protection.

title.children: Accuracy a major concern as more doctors, hospitals turn to AI

image.altText: lions lying down

props.synopsis: It's understood the woman lost an arm after the incident at the Darling Downs Zoo near Toowoomba.

title.children: Woman was watching keepers at work when she was bitten by lion

image.altText: Beau Webster, Shamar Joseph and Josh Hazlewood

props.synopsis: A telling contribution from Beau Webster, another canine cameo and a wildly swinging West Indies tail combine to hand Australia an unassailable 2-0 series lead. Here are the quick hits from day four in Grenada.

title.children: Five quick hits: More canine chaos and crushing blows in Grenada

image.altText: Indian bowler Akash Deep smiles at the crowd, holding the ball and a stump after taking 10 wickets for the match in a Test win.

props.synopsis: India sweeps aside England at Edgbaston to level the Test series with three matches to come, as Jasprit Bumrah's replacement, Akash Deep, destroys the home batting.

title.children: Deep inspires India to series-tying win over England in second Test

image.altText: Photograph of the picture book 'All Brains Are Different' stacked next to 'Supporting Autistic Girls' and 'So You're Autistic'.

props.synopsis: A new wave of picture books written by Australian authors is tackling the ways children view being neurodivergent. And experts say picture books can help families struggling with identity and confidence issues.

title.children: Our autistic child is 'magic-brained'. These books help her remember that

image.altText: Allan Alaalatoa of the Wallabies looks on during the Test against Fiji.

props.synopsis: Mastering the basics will be a priority for Joe Schmidt's Wallabies squad after a scratchy performance against Fiji ahead of the blockbuster three-Test series against the British and Irish Lions.

title.children: Why an F-word is on the Wallabies' lips ahead of Lions Test series

image.altText: A concept drawing of the chocolate experience showing a large chocolate fountain.

props.synopsis: The idea seemed to come out of the blue — $12 million for the "world's tallest chocolate fountain" at a new Cadbury tour in Hobart. Documents show how a tourism developer got government grants and landed the promise from Premier Jeremy Rockliff.

title.children: Where is the 'chocolate fountain' promised to Tasmanians at the 2024 election?

image.altText: 2025-06-06T060538Z_340498249_RC2JSEAYFASX_RTRMADP_3_USA-TRUMP-MUSK-FRUSTRATION

props.synopsis: Elon Musk's announcement comes after the president signed his signature bill into law on Friday, a move Mr Musk says will bankrupt the country.

title.children: Musk-Trump feud escalates as Tesla boss forms the 'America Party'

image.altText: RSPCA Queensland spokesman Michael Beatty

props.synopsis: The colourful Queensland media figure carved out a successful career as a current affairs reporter, covering royal weddings, the downfall of the Marcos regime and the Brixton riots before joining the RSPCA in 2004.

title.children: Veteran journalist and RSPCA spokesman Michael Beatty dies aged 76
